content: I have a bit of difficulty with #11. It seems it discounts helping and inspiring others who are less fortunate than yourself. I understand the value in surrounding ourselves with people who will advance and challenge us, but that logic also means those people are spending time with someone who does not advance and challenge them (us). I think empowering people in general makes us better, particularly if they may not have much (if anything), in return, to give. Thoughts?
